other_tests.findings: After the third ECT, the patient showed increased interest in her appearance and activities. Bilateral upper limb asterixis developed after the 7th and 10th ECTs.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Depression improved with each ECT, and asterixis suggested a metabolic encephalopathy leading to the diagnosis of primary hyperparathyroidism. Follow-up calcium levels remained above normal and phosphorus levels continued to be below normal.

other_tests.findings: PTH level was elevated at 44 pEq/ml two weeks after the 10th ECT.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Repeat PTH level one month after discharge was 35 pEq/ml, which is still consistent with primary hyperparathyroidism.
